text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at an example together. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name is spending too much time watching TV before her homework is finished. @data.characters.f1_mother.name helps him create a family rule about this:

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at an example together. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name is spending too much time watching TV before her homework is finished. @data.characters.f1_mother.name helps him create a family rule about this:

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “What do you think would be a fair rule?”

@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Hmmm…well, maybe I can use the phonewatch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework?”

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “What do you think would be a fair rule?”

@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Hmmm…well, maybe I can use the phonewatch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework?”

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 30 minutes per day so that you have time for other fun and relaxing things too. How does that sound?”
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Fine.”@data.characters.f1_mother.name: I’ll set a timer to let us know when you have 5 minutes left.

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 30 minutes per day so that you have time for other fun and relaxing things too. How does that sound?”
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Fine.”@data.characters.f1_mother.name: I’ll set a timer to let us know when you have 5 minutes left.

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe!


@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: Thank you, Mummy!

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe!


@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: Thank you, Mummy!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name created a rule together.

quiz_1_question.eng: Why does @data.characters.f1_mother.name ask @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name for her ideas on what the household rule should be?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Not quite.. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better because your child will feel involved.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: To make it more likely that she follows the rule.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: Because @data.characters.f1_mother.name is not sure how to make the rule herself.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Actually it’s to make @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name feel that her ideas are valued.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: To make sure she feels the rule is fair and realistic

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

quiz_2_question.eng:
How does @data.characters.f1_mother.name make sure that @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name is safe online? 
 What does @data.characters.f1_mother.name do when @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name follows the rule?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: A) She creates household rules around gadget use She praises her

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
If you chose A, D, or E, you are correct! The mother 
✅ sets a household rule to limit gadget use to 30 minutes a day
✅ Asks her daughter to wait until she's older for a social media account
✅ Advises against clicking on pop-ups
✅Encourages her daughter to come talk to her if anything upsets her online
.Yes, by doing this @data.characters.f1_mother.name makes it more likely that @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name will keep following the rule about TV watching.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng:
B) She allowed her daughter to create a social media account 
She tells her she doesn’t have to follow the rule anymore.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Try again! Letting a child have a social media account too soon can be tricky. Waiting until they’re older helps make sure they’re ready and know how to use it safely and responsibly.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: C) She allowed her daughter to use the phone only after completing her schoolwork

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Try again! Letting your child use the phone after schoolwork is a smart move to teach responsibility. But you need to also set rules on screen time to keep things balanced and ensure they’re enjoying other activities too!

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: D) She told her daughter to  avoid clicking on pop-ups or strange pictures

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng:
If you chose A, D, or E, you are correct! The mother 
✅ sets a household rule to limit gadget use to 30 minutes a day
✅ Asks her daughter to wait until she's older for a social media account
✅ Advises against clicking on pop-ups
✅Encourages her daughter to come talk to her if anything upsets her online

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: E) She told her daughter to come to her if anything upsets them

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng:
If you chose A, D, or E, you are correct! The mother 
✅ sets a household rule to limit gadget use to 30 minutes a day
✅ Asks her daughter to wait until she's older for a social media account
✅ Advises against clicking on pop-ups
✅Encourages her daughter to come talk to her if anything upsets her online

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at another family. They have set up a routine around bedtime that is working really well!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at another family. They have set up a routine around bedtime that is working really well!

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your blocks, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. In 5 minutes, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can read a story together.”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Okay!”

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your blocks, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. In 5 minutes, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can read a story together.”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Okay!”

text_2.eng:
*5 minutes later*

 @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Time to get ready for bed, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.”

rows.text_2:
*5 minutes later*

 @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Time to get ready for bed, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.”

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “You were so well-behaved in the bath, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.”

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “You were so well-behaved in the bath, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.”

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!”

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!”

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have time to read a story. Which book would you like to read?”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Yay! Can you read me the story about the lion?”

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have time to read a story. Which book would you like to read?”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Yay! Can you read me the story about the lion?”

text_2.eng:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “ “The end….” I’m glad you chose that story for us to read, it’s one of my favourites! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.”

@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Goodnight, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name.”

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “ “The end….” I’m glad you chose that story for us to read, it’s one of my favourites! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.”

@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Goodnight, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name.”

quiz_1_question.eng: How often do you think @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Try again. If @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name only do these steps once a week, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name would not be able to remember and follow the routine as well as she does here.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Try again. Following these steps only a few times a week may confuse @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, and she may struggle to follow the routine as well as she does here.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
Exactly. Being consistent with a routine – especially at the end of the day when everyone is tired – makes activities easier to follow for children. 

With a bit of practice, bedtime can become a happy time of connecting with your child!

quiz_2_question.eng: What does @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name do to help @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: She connects with @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name before giving instructions

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, connecting properly helps encourage @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She warns her that there will be consequences if she doesn’t follow the routine.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: No, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name doesn’t have to use consequences but she does promise a reward, which helped @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: She gives @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name a transition warning for each step of the routine.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, knowing which step comes next helps @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Not quite. What’s important about the instructions is that she gives them one at a time. This means @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name doesn’t get confused and helps her to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: She lets @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name do the routine by herself.

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Not quite, but she does praise her after each step. This will help @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to remember how to follow the routine successfully next time.
